description: Creates a cluster. All nodes in the cluster run the same protocol-compliant engine software.

parameters.name: ClusterName
parameters.description: The name of the cluster. This value must be unique as it also serves as the cluster identifier.

parameters.name: NodeType
parameters.description: The compute and memory capacity of the nodes in the cluster.

parameters.name: SecurityGroupIds
parameters.description: A list of security group names to associate with this cluster. (string) ---

parameters.name: MaintenanceWindow
parameters.description: Specifies the weekly time range during which maintenance on the cluster is performed. It is specified as a range in the format ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi (24H Clock UTC). The minimum maintenance window is a 60 minute period. Valid values for ddd are: sun mon tue wed thu fri sat Example: sun:23:00-mon:01:30

parameters.name: SnapshotArns
parameters.description: A list of Amazon Resource Names (ARN) that uniquely identify the RDB snapshot files stored in Amazon S3. The snapshot files are used to populate the new cluster. The Amazon S3 object name in the ARN cannot contain any commas. (string) ---

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: A list of tags to be added to this resource. Tags are comma-separated key,value pairs (e.g. Key=myKey, Value=myKeyValue. You can include multiple tags as shown following: Key=myKey, Value=myKeyValue Key=mySecondKey, Value=mySecondKeyValue. (dict) --- A tag that can be added to an MemoryDB resource. Tags are composed of a Key/Value pair. You can use tags to categorize and track all your MemoryDB resources. When you add or remove tags on clusters, those actions will be replicated to all nodes in the cluster. A tag with a null Value is permitted. For more information, see Tagging your MemoryDB resources Key (string) --- The key for the tag. May not be null. Value (string) --- The tag's value. May be null.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key for the tag. May not be null.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The tag's value. May be null.

parameters.name: SnapshotWindow
parameters.description: The daily time range (in UTC) during which MemoryDB begins taking a daily snapshot of your shard. Example: 05:00-09:00 If you do not specify this parameter, MemoryDB automatically chooses an appropriate time range.

parameters.name: ACLName
parameters.description: The name of the Access Control List to associate with the cluster.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The user-supplied name of the cluster. This identifier is a unique key that identifies a cluster.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the cluster.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the cluster. For example, Available, Updating, Creating.

nested_items.name: PendingUpdates
nested_items.description: A group of settings that are currently being applied.

nested_items.name: Resharding
nested_items.description: The status of an online resharding operation.

nested_items.name: SlotMigration
nested_items.description: The status of the online resharding slot migration.

nested_items.name: ProgressPercentage
nested_items.description: The percentage of the slot migration that is complete.

nested_items.name: ACLToApply
nested_items.description: A list of ACLs pending to be applied.

nested_items.name: ServiceUpdates
nested_items.description: A list of service updates being applied to the cluster.

nested_items.name: ServiceUpdateName
nested_items.description: The unique ID of the service update.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the service update.

nested_items.name: MultiRegionClusterName
nested_items.description: The name of the multi-Region cluster that this cluster belongs to.

nested_items.name: NumberOfShards
nested_items.description: The number of shards in the cluster.

nested_items.name: Shards
nested_items.description: A list of shards that are members of the cluster.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the shard.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current state of this replication group - creating, available, modifying, deleting.

nested_items.name: Slots
nested_items.description: The keyspace for this shard.

nested_items.name: Nodes
nested_items.description: A list containing information about individual nodes within the shard.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The node identifier. A node name is a numeric identifier (0001, 0002, etc.). The combination of cluster name, shard name and node name uniquely identifies every node used in a customer's Amazon account.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the service update on the node.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone in which the node resides.

nested_items.name: CreateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the node was created.

nested_items.name: Address
nested_items.description: The DNS hostname of the node.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port number that the engine is listening on.

nested_items.name: NumberOfNodes
nested_items.description: The number of nodes in the shard.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityMode
nested_items.description: Indicates if the cluster has a Multi-AZ configuration (multiaz) or not (singleaz).

nested_items.name: ClusterEndpoint
nested_items.description: The cluster's configuration endpoint.

nested_items.name: Address
nested_items.description: The DNS hostname of the node.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port number that the engine is listening on.

nested_items.name: NodeType
nested_items.description: The cluster's node type.

nested_items.name: Engine
nested_items.description: The name of the engine used by the cluster.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: The Redis OSS engine version used by the cluster.

nested_items.name: EnginePatchVersion
nested_items.description: The Redis OSS engine patch version used by the cluster.

nested_items.name: ParameterGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the parameter group used by the cluster.

nested_items.name: ParameterGroupStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the parameter group used by the cluster, for example --active' or --applying'.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroups
nested_items.description: A list of security groups used by the cluster.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the security group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the security group membership. The status changes whenever a security group is modified, or when the security groups assigned to a cluster are modified.

nested_items.name: SubnetGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the subnet group used by the cluster.

nested_items.name: TLSEnabled
nested_items.description: A flag to indicate if In-transit encryption is enabled.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the KMS key used to encrypt the cluster.

nested_items.name: ARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.

nested_items.name: SnsTopicArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS notification topic.

nested_items.name: SnsTopicStatus
nested_items.description: The SNS topic must be in Active status to receive notifications.

nested_items.name: SnapshotRetentionLimit
nested_items.description: The number of days for which MemoryDB retains automatic snapshots before deleting them. For example, if you set SnapshotRetentionLimit to 5, a snapshot that was taken today is retained for 5 days before being deleted.

nested_items.name: MaintenanceWindow
nested_items.description: Specifies the weekly time range during which maintenance on the cluster is performed. It is specified as a range in the format ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi (24H Clock UTC). The minimum maintenance window is a 60 minute period.

nested_items.name: SnapshotWindow
nested_items.description: The daily time range (in UTC) during which MemoryDB begins taking a daily snapshot of your shard. Example: 05:00-09:00 If you do not specify this parameter, MemoryDB automatically chooses an appropriate time range.

nested_items.name: ACLName
nested_items.description: The name of the Access Control List associated with this cluster.

nested_items.name: AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
nested_items.description: When set to true, the cluster will automatically receive minor engine version upgrades after launch.

nested_items.name: DataTiering
nested_items.description: Enables data tiering. Data tiering is only supported for clusters using the r6gd node type. This parameter must be set when using r6gd nodes. For more information, see Data tiering.

nested_items.name: NetworkType
nested_items.description: The IP address type for the cluster. Returns --ipv4' for IPv4 only, --ipv6' for IPv6 only, or --dual-stack' if the cluster supports both IPv4 and IPv6 addressing.

nested_items.name: IpDiscovery
nested_items.description: The mechanism that the cluster uses to discover IP addresses. Returns --ipv4' when DNS endpoints resolve to IPv4 addresses, or --ipv6' when DNS endpoints resolve to IPv6 addresses.
